tags.name: Groups
tags.description: Groups are subdivisions within organizations. Every user will be in at least one group, and every shortened link will be in one group. Most actions on our API will be on behalf of a group. For example, when you shorten a link, it will be on behalf of a user and a group.

tags.name: Organizations
tags.description: Organizations are equivalent to a Bitly account. Every plan limit, group, and user is tied to an organization.

tags.name: User
tags.description: Some subscription plans allow multiple users. Only one user is used for authenticating a call, and these operations apply only to the authenticated user.

tags.name: BSDs
tags.description: Branded short domains (BSDs) are the custom domains used to brand your links. A BSD can be added to a Bitly organization and may be assigned to one or more groups. They can contain up to 32 characters.

tags.name: Bitlinks
tags.description: Bitlinks are shortened links. They could begin with the bit.ly domain or your own custom branded short domain (BSD).

tags.name: Custom Bitlinks
tags.description: These endpoints are for updating custom Bitlinks only. Custom Bitlinks have both a BSD and a customized back-half (e.g., yourcompany.com/yourcampaign). If a link begins with the bit.ly domain or ends with an auto-generated random string it is not a custom Bitlink.

tags.name: Campaigns
tags.description: Bitly Campaigns are used to build and organize links and metrics for marketing campaigns.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: Webhooks are a method of sending information from Bitly to an application outside of Bitly. It's a way to automate actions or updates between two different systems. These endpoints are for configuring your webhooks.

tags.name: Deeplinks
tags.description: Deeplinks refers to links that direct a user to a location inside of a mobile application. Bitly allows accounts to configure varying implementations of Deeplinks.

tags.name: Billing
tags.description: All endpoints under this tag are related to accounts subscribing to the Bitly service.

tags.name: Tiers
tags.description: Tiers references what level subscription a Bitly account is under.

tags.name: SSO
tags.description: SSO is an acronym for Single Sign-On. This relates to a method of authentication used by some Bitly accounts.

tags.name: Invitations
tags.description: Invitations allow new users to be invited to a Bitly organization via email or username. These endpoints handle both creation, retrieval, and deletion of invitations tied to an organization.

tags.name: Bulk Shorten
tags.description: Bulk Shorten references the capability for users to upload a csv of links they would like to shorten and optionally customize.

tags.name: Launchpads
tags.description: A link launchpad is a customizable page that contains a collection of links. These endpoints allow for the customization of the links associated with this site and the appearance of the site itself.

tags.name: Images
tags.description: Images can be uploaded to be use in a Bitly QR code. Images can be uploaded, cropped, re-cropped, and fetched via the API. Each image includes an Image GUID and a public URL hosting the image.

tags.name: QR Codes
tags.description: QR codes can be created and customized with different dot patterns, corner shapes, colors, and more. They can contain bitlinks, links to microsites, or several kinds of static data.

post.description: Converts a long url to a Bitlink. You may see errors returned from this endpoint - "BRANDED_LINK_MONTHLY_LIMIT_EXCEEDED" occurs if you have shortened more links than your account is configured for for the month, and "DNS_CONFIGURATION_ERROR" occurs if you are attempting to shorten links against a custom domain which doesn't have DNS properly configured.

X-Bsd-Error.description: An explanation of the DNS error received
An explanation of the DNS error received

X-Ratelimit-Reason.description: An explanation of the ratelimit received.

post.description: Converts a long url to a Bitlink and sets additional parameters. You may see errors returned from this endpoint - "BRANDED_LINK_MONTHLY_LIMIT_EXCEEDED" occurs if you have shortened more links than your account is configured for for the month, and "DNS_CONFIGURATION_ERROR" occurs if you are attempting to shorten links against a custom domain which doesn't have DNS properly configured.

patch.description: Updates fields in the specified link. To redirect the link (i.e. to update the Long URL), use PATCH /v4/custom_bitlinks/{custom_bitlink} (https://dev.bitly.com/api-reference/#updateCustomBitlink)

get.description: Returns information for the specified link.

post.description: Returns the short link and long URL for the specified link.

get.description: Returns the click counts for the specified link in an array based on a date.

get.summary: Get a Clicks Summary for a Bitlink
get.description: Returns the click counts for the specified link rolled up into a single field.

get.summary: Get Metrics for a Bitlink by Country
get.description: Returns the country origins of click traffic for the specified link.

get.summary: Get Metrics for a Bitlink by City
get.description: Returns the city origins of click traffic for the specified link.

text/csv.example:
City, Subregion, Region, Country, Clicks
New York, , NY, US, 5

get.summary: Get Metrics for a Bitlink by Device Type

get.summary: Get Metrics for a Bitlink by Referrers

Referrers, Domain/Sub-Domain, Clicks
Other Sites, direct, 5

get.summary: Get Metrics for a Bitlink by Referrer Name
get.description: Returns referrer click counts for the specified link.

get.summary: Get Metrics for a Bitlink by Referring Domains
get.description: Returns the referring domain click counts for the specified link.

get.summary: Get Metrics for a Bitlink by Referrers by Domain
get.description: Returns click metrics grouped by referrers for the specified link.

post.description: Add a keyword (or "custom back-half") to a Bitlink with a Custom Domain (domains must match). This endpoint can also be used for initial redirects to a link.

patch.description: Move a keyword (or custom back-half) to a different Bitlink (domains must match).

get.description: Returns the details and history of the specified link.

get.summary: Get Metrics for a Custom Bitlink by Destination
get.description: Returns click metrics for the specified link by its historical destinations.

get.summary: Get Clicks for a Custom Bitlink's Entire History
get.description: Returns the click counts for the specified link. This returns an array with clicks based on a date.

get.description: Returns a list of Bitlinks sorted by group. The list of custom bitlinks has newest entries first.

post.description: Create a new QR Code and return its metadata

patch.description: Updates the QR code with a matching id and returns it.

Lowest Error Correction.title: Lowest Error Correction QR Code Updated

get.description: Gets the QR code with a matching id.

Retrieves a list of QR codes matching the filter settings. Values are in reverse chronological order.
The pagination occurs by calling the next link in the pagination response object.

Get an image of a given QR code with a matching id and a format based on the Accept header.
If a base64 encoded value inside of JSON is preferred send Accept: application/json.
In addition to Accept: application/json the image format can be specified using the query parameter 'format'.
If no format is specified anywhere the default will be SVG.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The file format for the QR code's image. If the accept header is application/json the image data will be wrapped in a json object.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format type of the image. If there is an image format in the header it takes precedence.

get.summary: Get Scans for a QR Code
get.description: Returns an array of scan counts for the specified QR code. The array is comprised of scan counts for each time window, where the window is based on the provided unit.

get.summary: Get Scans Summary for a QR Code
get.description: Returns the scan counts for a QR Code rolled up into a single field for a specified time window, where the window is based on the provided unit.

get.summary: Get Scans for a QR Code by Country
get.description: Returns the country origins of scan traffic for the specified QR Code.

get.summary: Get Metrics for a QR Code by City
get.description: Returns the city origins of scan traffic for the specified QR Code.

text/csv.example:
City, Subregion, Region, Country, Scans
New York, , NY, US, 5

get.summary: Get Scans for a QR Code by Device OS
get.description: Returns the device os generating scan traffic for the specified QR Code.

get.summary: Get Scans for a QR Code by Browser
get.description: Returns the browsers generating scan traffic to the specified QR Code.
Retrieves a QR code for a Bitlink.

include_max_history.description: Includes the maximum available history for the user in the report. Default is false.

max_history_minimum_count.description: The minimum number of clicks a link must have in order to be included in the report during their max history. Default is 0 which means all links are included. For example, value of 100 means only links at least a 100 clicks during this time period (max history) will be included in the report.

metrics_columns.description: Parameters for custom metrics column in the report. Each entry in the array will result in a new metrics column in the report.

from.description: Unix of the start of the date time range for this column to be included in the report.

to.description: Unix of the end of the date time range for this column to be included in the report.

csv_header_prefix.description: Metrics column header on the csv follow the format  "%s (01/01/2020 - 01/01/2022)." This field determines what goes on the first %s. For example, "Engagements Custom Date Range" will result in "Engagements Custom Date Range (01/01/2020 - 01/01/2022)".

minimum_count.description: The minimum number of clicks a link must have in order to be included in the report. Default is 0. For example, minimum_count 100 means only links with at least a 100 clicks during this time period will be included in the report.

unix_from.description: Unix of the start of the date time range for this column to be included in the report.

unix_to.description: Unix of the end of the date time range for this column to be included in the report.

csv_header_prefix.description: Metrics column header on the csv follow the format  "%s (01/01/2020 - 01/01/2022)." This field determines what goes on the first %s. For example, "Engagements Custom Date Range" will result in "Engagements Custom Date Range (01/01/2020 - 01/01/2022)".

minimum_count.description: The minimum number of clicks a link must have in order to be included in the report. Default is 0. For example, minimum_count 100 means only links with at least a 100 clicks during this time period will be included in the report.

id.description: The domain and backhalf of the parent override

target_bitlink_id.description: The domain and backhalf of the underlying hash link

hash.description: The backhalf of the underlying hash link

QRCode.description: A full QR code with data and customization values

qrcode_id.description: The QR code's id, as a guid

scannability.description: A decimal number between 0 and 1 representing how likely the QR code is to scan properly, 0 being unscannable and 1 being very scannable

is_hidden.description: A boolean representing if the QR code is being hidden from the user

is_customized.description: A boolean representing if any of the QR code's customization values have been changed from their default setting

serialized_content.description: The serialized string of the QR code's content

customization_hash.description: A hash calculated from all the QR code's customization fields

full_hash.description: A hash calculated from all the QR code's customization and content fields

created_ts.description: The unix epoch time when the QR code was created. This field will be deprecated soon. Use created instead.

modified_ts.description: The unix epoch time when the QR code was updated. Use modified instead of this field. Deprecation soon.

svg.description: The QR code's svg image data as a data uri

png.description: The QR code's png image data as a data uri

jpg.description: The QR code's jpg image data as a data uri

thumbnail.description: The QR code's thumbnail image data as a data uri. Can be svg, png, jpg

values.description: A list of GS1 application identifiers and their values

key.description: A valid GS1 application identifier, qualifier, attribute, etc.

value.description: A syntactically correct value associated with the application identifier in the key field.

id.description: The QR code template's id, as a shortid

brand_guid.description: The Bitly brand_guid preference for use in the Bitly Canva app

customization_hash.description: A hash calculated from all the QR code's customization fields

premade.description: A boolean representing whether this is a default template premade by bitly

is_active.description: A boolean representing if this template is currently active

created_ts.description: The unix epoch time when the QR code template was created

modified_ts.description: The unix epoch time when the QR code template was updated

svg.description: The QR code template's thumbnail svg image data as a data uri

long_url.description: The destination URL the QR should point to. Always use long_url or bitlink, not both.

bitlink.description: The bitlink the QR should point to. Always use long_url or bitlink, not both.

response_format.description: The file format to be returned after creation. Call GET /v4/qrcodes/{qrcode id} to get the QR code in a different format after creation.

is_customized.description: A boolean representing if any of the QR code's customization values have been changed from their default setting

QRCodeCorners.description: An object representing all three corners of the QR code. The corners corresponding to each property are: corner_1 = top left, corner_2 = top right, and corner_3 = bottom right

outer_color.description: The outer color of a corner of the QR code in hex code format

shape.description: The shape one of the QR code's corners should take

style.description: The style of the gradient. Can be either linear or radial.

angle.description: The angle by which the gradient will be rotated. Only applies to linear gradients.

colors.description: The list of hex colors and their offsets to be used in the gradient.

color.description: A color in hexadecimal format to be used in one of the gradient's <stop> elements

offset.description: A number between 0-100 denoting the offset of the gradient color, interpreted as a percentage

image_guid.description: A GUID for an image uploaded to Bitly
A GUID for an image uploaded to Bitly

crop_type.description: The type of crop, either rectangular or circular, to be used on the logo

crop.description: An object denoting the position and size of the crop

x.description: The x coordinate used to position the crop

y.description: The y coordinate used to position the crop

w.description: The width of the crop. Will instead be used as the radius for a circular crop.

h.description: The height of the crop. Will be completely disregarded for a circular crop.

bitly_brand.description: A boolean that determines if the QR code should have the bitly brand in its bottom right corner

id.description: The unique id of the selected frame

colors.description: An object of named colors denoting which color should go to which area of the frame

primary.description: The primary color of the frame in hex code format

secondary.description: The secondary color of the frame in hex code format

background.description: The background color of the frame in hex code format

text.description: The text to be inserted into the QR code's frame

id.description: The unique id of the selected frame

immutable.description: A readonly value denoting if the user should be able to customize the frame

colors.description: An object of named colors denoting which color should go to which area of the frame

primary.description: The primary color of the frame in hex code format

secondary.description: The secondary color of the frame in hex code format

background.description: The background color of the frame in hex code format

text.description: The text to be inserted into the QR code's frame

thumbnail.description: The QR code's thumbnail image data as a data uri. Can be svg, png, jpg. Only used in response bodies.
A QR code shape's thumbnail image data as a data uri. Can be svg, png, jpg. Only used in response bodies.

is_hidden.description: If true, this frame will be hidden from the selectable frames in the UI.  It does not stop you from using this frame.  We use this for seasonal frames.

QRCodeText.description: Contains the center, top, and bottom text to be used in the QR code

Text.description: An object describing text with color

color.description: The color of the text in hex code format

QRCodeShape.description: Describes the shape of the QR code's container

angle.description: The angle from 0-360 at which the QR code's shape should be rotated

outline.description: The outline of the QR code's shape, formatted like a CSS border shorthand

content_ratio.description: Denotes how much of the container should be taken up by the QR code itself e.g. 0.7 would mean the QR code takes up 70% the container

QRCodeShapeItem.description: The response object detailing a QR code shape with id and thumbnail

thumbnail.description: A QR code shape's thumbnail image data as a data uri. Can be svg, png, jpg. Only used in response bodies.

QRCodeDynamic.description: An object containing relevant properties for dynamic QR codes, i.e. ones that are linked to a bitlink

dynamic_id.description: A unique id acting like a foreign key to reference the dynamic content. For bitlinks this would be the `<domain>/<backhalf>`, for other content it should be a standard guid.

total_scan_count.description: A calculated field representing the number of times the QR code has been scanned

QRCodeStatic.description: An object containing relevant properties for static QR codes, i.e. ones that are NOT linked to a bitlink

QRCodeVirtualCard.description: A vertual card, usually business card, stored in a QR code

phone_numbers.description: A list of the card owner's phone numbers

QRCodeWifi.description: Wifi login information stored in a QR code

encryption.description: The type of encryption that the wifi uses

QRCodeEmail.description: A preconfigured email message stored in a QR code

QRCodePhoneNumber.description: A phone number stored in a QR code

QRCodeTextMessage.description: A preconfigured text message stored in a QR code

qrcode_id.description: The QR code's id, as a guid

thumbnail.description: The QR code's thumbnail image data as a data uri. Can be svg, png, jpg. Only used in response bodies.
The QR code's thumbnail image data as a data uri. Can be svg, png, jpg. Only used in response bodies.
The QR code's thumbnail image data as a data uri. Can be svg, png, jpg. Only used in response bodies.

QRCodeTypeEnum.description: The type of dynamic/static content the QR serves, e.g. Link In Bio page, micro site, bitlink, email, text, Wifi, etc.

dynamic.description: A list of dynamic QR code types, such as bitlink, email, link in bio, micro site, etc.

static.description: A list of static QR code types, such as wifi password, email, text message, etc.

QRCodeShapeType.description: The enclosing shape of the entire qr code. Square is the default.

QRCodeSpecSettingsPublic.description: The QR code's editable spec settings, which for now is just the error correction

error_correction.description: The amount of error correction that the QR code was generated with

QRCodeSpecSettings.description: The QR code's version, error correction, and mask values

version.description: The QR code's selected version, determined automatically when the QR code is generated

error_correction.description: The amount of error correction that the QR code was generated with

mask.description: The mask value, which changes the QR codes dot arrangement without changing the underlying data

thumbnail.description: A QR code shape's thumbnail image data as a data url. Can be svg, png, jpg. Only used in response bodies.

qr_code.description: The data uri for the QR code

qr_uri.description: The data uri of the code

Locked.description: Determines whether the user has acccess to this field

link_created.description: whether the Links product has been utilized

qr_code_created.description: whether the QR Codes product has been utilized

lib_created.description: whether the Link-in-bio product has been utilized

analytics_dashboard_created.description: whether the Analytics Dashboard product has been utilized

PublicCanvaUserBrand.description: An object representing a Canva UserBrand record

login.description: The Bitly login associated with the canva_user_id and canva_brand_id

brand_guid.description: The Bitly brand_guid preference for use in the Bitly Canva app

org_guid.description: The Bitly org_guid preference for use in the Bitly Canva app

UpdateCanvaUserBrand.description: The request body for updating a Canva UserBrands preferred Brand GUID and inferred Org GUID

brand_guid.description: The Bitly brand_guid preference for use in the Bitly Canva app

CreateFocusRequest.description: The request body for creating a Focus record

qrcode_id.description: The ID of the QR code

CreateFocusResponse.description: The response body after creating a Focus record, containing the continue URL

continue_url.description: The URL that deep links to the Canva app

GetFocusResponse.description: The response body for getting a Focus record

qrcode_id.description: The ID of the QR code

CreateOrgDomainVerificationEmailRequest.description: The request body for validating and sending an org domain verification request email

org_guid.description: Org GUID which the admin user belongs to, and is requesting to create a controlled domain

domain.description: Domain which the admin user is requesting to create an org controlled domain

OrgDomainVerification.description: The object representing an Org Domain Verification record

uuid.description: UUID for the Org Domain Verification Record

org_guid.description: Org GUID which the admin user belongs to, and is requesting to create a controlled domain

domain.description: Domain which the admin user is requesting to create an org controlled domain

login.description: Login of the admin user requesting to create an org controlled domain

email.description: Email of the admin user which the org domain verification email is sent

PatchOrgControlledDomain.description: The request body for updating a controlled domain's status

is_active.description: The active status of the controlled domain

PatchOrgInvitationRequest.description: The request body for updating an organization invitation request

status.description: Status of the organization invitation request

email.description: Email address of the user requesting to join the organization

login.description: Bitly login of the user requesting to join the organization
